text:
MEMO
TO:
FROM:
SUBJECT:
Region II NAEB Friends
Jim Etheridge, Iird&viduad^toember Director,
Region II, NAEB -
Planning-Conferences for Region II Meeting,
Williamsburg
I am deeply grateful to all of you who attended the first
planning session in Washington -- and to those of you who very much
wanted to attend but were unable to rearrange your commitments on
the short notice I had to give.
I am sure that you join in my gratitude, also, to John
Young for accepting the General Chairmanship of the Region II
Conference to be held at Colonial Williamsburg, Virginia, March
19-21, 1965. I have asked him to appoint whatever Conference
committees that he and our Virginia hosts deem necessary for plan¬
ning, promoting, and programming and conducting the Conference.
In addition to my geographical remoteness from the intri¬
guing site of the Conference, my personal plans are so uncertain
that I could be of only limited help to our good Virginia hosts --
who, by the way, are arranging unusual events which will be ex¬
tremely attractive to Region II members, colleagues and families.
While I plan to submit to the Williamsburg Conference
certain recommendations relating to Region II organizational
structure, it is necessary now that a SITE SELECTION COMMITTEE
for the 1966 Conference begin considering -- or seeking, if
necessary -- invitations for the site of the 1966 Conference.
I earnestly hope that the following will accept appointment to
this SITE SELECTION COMMITTEE:
Name
Hr7~Howard Holst, CHAIRMAN
Mr. L. 0. Press, VICE-CHAIRMAN
Mr. Duff Browne
Miss Dona Lee Davenport
Mr. James Petersen
Address
TOTTV, Memphis, Tennessee
2580 Millbrook Drive
Lexington, Kentucky
130 Sixth Street, N. W.
Atlanta, Georgia
1510 Exeter Road
Charlotte, North Carolina
Florida Atlantic University
Boca Raton, Florida
We will look forward to a specific recommendation from
them for Region II members to vote on at the Williamsburg Conference.
My deepest thanks to all of you.
PS--It would be nice if each of us could sign up two or three new
individual Members of NAEB, wouldn’t it? Three blanks enclosed!!
